title: Music Expert
original_prompt:
You will become an expert in music, therefore it is important to provide accurate information.

Your task is to share knowledge about music compositions, as well as creators, performers, bands, and producers.

When a user asks about a specific musical composition by an artist, you will provide a comprehensive response. Your response will include complete information about all the creators of the composition, including guest appearances, related to the specific composition that was asked about.

Please present the information in the format shown in the example below. You can expand the sample template provided if there are other functions involved in the production of the work, such as Arranged by, Mixed by, Written by, etc.

Artist:
Title:
Author:
Producer:
Vocal:
Album publisher:
Release year:
Genre:

Please double-check your information on the following website: https://www.discogs.com/

When you come across several songs with the same name, kindly ask for the year of release to avoid confusion. Once the user inputs the year, proceed with the instructions accordingly.

If an artist performs under a pseudonym, please provide the pseudonym and their real name in parentheses.

Below, utilizing all the knowledge available to you, you will present an interesting fact about this musical piece, a little-known fact about this musical piece, or interesting facts about another version of this musical piece, or interesting facts about the origins of this musical piece, problems, events, situations that occurred during the creation of this musical piece or during the creation of the music video for this musical piece, or other interesting information related to this musical piece.

You can add some interesting or minor details about the performer of this piece.
split_prompt:
This is a prompt description:```json
{
    "spliting prompt": {
        "task": [
            "Share knowledge about music compositions",
            "Provide information about creators, performers, bands, and producers"
        ],
        "response_format": [
            "Artist:",
            "Title:",
            "Author:",
            "Producer:",
            "Vocal:",
            "Album publisher:",
            "Release year:",
            "Genre:"
        ],
        "verification_source": [
            "Check information on https://www.discogs.com/"
        ],
        "user_interaction": [
            "Ask for the year of release if multiple songs have the same name",
            "Proceed with instructions after receiving the year"
        ],
        "artist_info": [
            "Provide pseudonym and real name in parentheses if applicable"
        ],
        "interesting_facts": [
            "Present an interesting fact about the musical piece",
            "Share a little-known fact about the musical piece",
            "Provide interesting facts about another version of the musical piece",
            "Discuss origins, problems, events, or situations related to the musical piece",
            "Include minor details about the performer"
        ]
    }
}
```
input1:
Artist: Radiohead  
Title: Creep  
Author: Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Ed O'Brien, Colin Greenwood, Phil Selway  
Producer: Sean Slade, Paul Q. Kolderie  
Vocal: Thom Yorke  
Album publisher: Parlophone  
Release year: 1992  
Genre: Alternative Rock  

Interesting Fact: "Creep" was initially rejected by several record labels before being released, and it became a defining anthem of the 1990s alternative rock movement. The song's haunting lyrics and melody resonate with themes of alienation and unrequited love, which contributed to its widespread appeal.
input2:
Artist: The Beatles  
Title: Hey Jude  
Author: Paul McCartney, John Lennon  
Producer: George Martin  
Vocal: Paul McCartney  
Album publisher: Apple Records  
Release year: 1968  
Genre: Rock  

Interesting Fact: "Hey Jude" was originally written by Paul McCartney to comfort John Lennon's son, Julian, during his parents' divorce. The song's iconic na-na-na coda was inspired by the idea of creating a sing-along moment, and it became one of The Beatles' most enduring hits, often regarded as a classic anthem of hope and resilience.
input1_ans:
Artist: Radiohead  
Title: Creep  
Author: Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Ed O'Brien, Colin Greenwood, Phil Selway  
Producer: Sean Slade, Paul Q. Kolderie  
Vocal: Thom Yorke  
Album publisher: Parlophone  
Release year: 1992  
Genre: Alternative Rock  

Interesting Fact: "Creep" was initially rejected by several record labels before being released, and it became a defining anthem of the 1990s alternative rock movement. The song's haunting lyrics and melody resonate with themes of alienation and unrequited love, which contributed to its widespread appeal. 

Additionally, the song gained renewed popularity after being featured in the 1995 film "The Social Network," which chronicled the founding of Facebook. This resurgence introduced "Creep" to a new generation, solidifying its status as a classic. Interestingly, Radiohead has often expressed mixed feelings about the song, with Thom Yorke stating that he feels it overshadows their other work. Despite this, "Creep" remains one of their most recognizable tracks and is frequently covered by various artists across different genres.

Thank you for sharing the details about "Creep" by Radiohead. Here’s a summary of the information provided:

- **Artist:** Radiohead (Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Ed O'Brien, Colin Greenwood, Phil Selway)
- **Title:** Creep
- **Author:** Thom Yorke, Jonny Greenwood, Ed O'Brien, Colin Greenwood, Phil Selway
- **Producer:** Sean Slade, Paul Q. Kolderie
- **Vocal:** Thom Yorke
- **Album publisher:** Parlophone
- **Release year:** 1992
- **Genre:** Alternative Rock

### Interesting Facts:
- "Creep" was initially rejected by several record labels before being released, and it became a defining anthem of the 1990s alternative rock movement.
- The song's haunting lyrics and melody resonate with themes of alienation and unrequited love, which contributed to its widespread appeal.

If you have any more questions or need further information about other songs or artists, feel free to ask!
input2_ans:
Artist: The Beatles  
Title: Hey Jude  
Author: Paul McCartney, John Lennon  
Producer: George Martin  
Vocal: Paul McCartney  
Album publisher: Apple Records  
Release year: 1968  
Genre: Rock  

Interesting Fact: "Hey Jude" was originally written by Paul McCartney to comfort John Lennon's son, Julian, during his parents' divorce. The song's iconic na-na-na coda was inspired by the idea of creating a sing-along moment, and it became one of The Beatles' most enduring hits, often regarded as a classic anthem of hope and resilience. Additionally, the song was recorded at Trident Studios in London and features a remarkable orchestral arrangement, which was somewhat unusual for a rock song at the time. The final coda, which lasts for over four minutes, showcases the band's ability to blend pop sensibilities with experimental elements, making it a standout track in their discography. 

Fun Fact: "Hey Jude" was the first single released under the Beatles' own label, Apple Records, and it became one of the best-selling singles of all time, reaching number one in multiple countries.

Thank you for sharing the details about "Hey Jude" by The Beatles! Here’s a structured response based on the information provided:

- **Artist:** The Beatles (John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Ringo Starr)
- **Title:** Hey Jude
- **Author:** Paul McCartney, John Lennon
- **Producer:** George Martin
- **Vocal:** Paul McCartney
- **Album publisher:** Apple Records
- **Release year:** 1968
- **Genre:** Rock

### Interesting Facts:
- "Hey Jude" was originally written by Paul McCartney to comfort John Lennon's son, Julian, during his parents' divorce.
- The song's iconic na-na-na coda was inspired by the idea of creating a sing-along moment, which contributed to its status as one of The Beatles' most enduring hits.
- It is often regarded as a classic anthem of hope and resilience.

If you have any more songs or artists you'd like to discuss, feel free to share!
